item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Kiran Desai
item.description: "Could fulfillment ever be felt as deeply as loss? Romantically she decided that love must surely reside in the gap between desire and fulfillment, in the lack, not the contentment. Love was the ache, the anticipation, the retreat, everything around it but the emotion itself." -- Kiran Desai

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "He broke my heart. You merely broke my life." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Some prices are just too high, no matter how much you may want the prize. The one thing you can't trade for your heart's desire is your heart." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "If power was an illusion, wasn't weakness necessarily one also?" -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Silence may be as variously shaded as speech." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by oscar wilde
item.description: "Only the shallow know themselves" -- oscar wilde

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "I have spent weeks in the desert, forgetting to look at the moon, he says, as a married man may spend days never looking into the face of his wife. These are not sins of omission but signs of pre-occuopation." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "July 1936 There are betrayals in war that are childlike compared with our human betrayals during peace. The new lover enters the habits of the other. Things are smashed, revealed in new light. This is done with nervous or tender sentences, although the heart is an organ of fire. A love story is not about those who lose their heart but about those who find that sullen inhabitant who, when it is stumbled upon, means the body can fool no one, can fool nothing - not the wisdom of sleep or the habit of social graces. It is a consuming of oneself and the past." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "One writes of scars healed, a loose parallel to the pathology of the skin, but there is no such thing in the life of an individual. There are open wounds, shrunk sometimes to the size of a pin-prick but wounds still. The marks of suffering are more comparable to the loss of a finger, or of the sight of an eye. We may not miss them, either, for one minute in a year, but if we should there is nothing to be done about it." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "How we are almost nothing. We think, in our youth, we are the centre of the universe, but we simply respond, go this way or that by accident, survive or improve by the luck of the draw, with little choice or determination on our part." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "She was dazzling-- alight; it was agony to comprehend her beauty in a glance." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "A woman should be able to kiss a man beautifully and romantically without any desire to be either his wife or his mistress." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
Sunaina add a quote by Shulamith Firestone
item.description: "If women are differentiated only by superficial physical attributes, men appear more individual and irreplaceable than they really are." -- Shulamith Firestone

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Home is where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "When you choose an action, you choose the consequences of that action. When you desire a consequence you had damned well better take the action that would create it." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Rumi Jalalud-Din
item.description: "Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death." -- Rumi Jalalud-Din

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "I don't suppose you have many friends. Neither do I. I don't trust people who say they have a lot of friends. It's a sure sign that they don't really know anyone." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "The rule for finding plots for character-centered novels, which is to ask: 'So what's the worst possible thing I can do to *this* guy?' And then do it." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Well, now If little by little you stop loving me I shall stop loving you Little by little If suddenly you forget me Do not look for me For I shall already have forgotten you
If you think it long and mad the wind of banners that passes through my life And you decide to leave me at the shore of the heart where I have roots Remember That on that day, at that hour, I shall lift my arms And my roots will set off to seek another land" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "If you make it plain you like people, it's hard for them to resist liking you back." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "There must have been moments even that afternoon when Daisy tumbled short of his dreams -- not through her own fault, but because of the colossal vitality of his illusion. It had gone beyond her, beyond everything. He had thrown himself into it with a creative passion, adding to it all the time, decking it out with every bright feather that drifted his way. No amount of fire or freshness can challenge what a man will store up in his ghostly heart." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know, is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romantic person has a desperate confidence that they won't." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sunaina add a quote by Jess C. Scott
item.description: "When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You know that your name is safe in their mouth." -- Jess C. Scott
